Description:
Key Responsibilities:Record and maintain financial transactions accurately using accounting software and Excel spreadsheets.
Prepare and review financial statements, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements.
Reconcile bank statements and ensure that all financial transactions are properly documented.
Analyze financial data to identify trends, discrepancies, and opportunities for cost savings or revenue growth.
Assist in the budgeting and forecasting process, providing valuable insights to support decision-making.
Process accounts payable and accounts receivable transactions, ensuring timely payments and collections.
Perform month-end and year-end close procedures, including adjusting journal entries and account reconciliations.
Prepare and file tax returns in compliance with local and national regulations.
Collaborate with auditors during internal and external audits, providing necessary documentation and explanations.
Assist in the development and implementation of financial policies and procedures to enhance efficiency and compliance..Skills
Skills:
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. A Certified Public Accountant (CPA) certification is a plus.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions such as VLOOKUP, PivotTables, and formula creation.
Solid understanding of accounting principles and financial reporting standards (GAAP/IFRS).
Experience with accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Xero, SAP) and financial modeling tools.
Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy in data entry and financial analysis.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for collaborating with team members and presenting financial information to non-finance personnel.
Ability to meet deadlines and work well under pressure.
Knowledge of tax regulations and compliance requirements.
Ethical behavior and a commitment to confidentiality in handling financial data.
